On Jun 12, 2007, at 12:32 PM, Jon Hanna wrote:

> Finally (not relevant to you, but fills out the caching vs. privacy
> spectrum) Cache-Control: no-store is what you want if security needs
> mean all caches must be mistrusted.

How much trust can one put in this restriction in the real world,  
i.e. do all relevant caching implementations honor this appropriately?

Stefan
